file_content.text: What was that thing?
We've been calling them Monoliths.
I promise I wasn't eavesdropping. Just wanted to warn you.
We've seen several of those creatures appearing throughout New Adasta. They're made from Sith alchemy. A sign of Vitiate's growing power.
Extremely strong, next to impossible to kill. The one you just defeated is the smallest we've come across.
Its power's already returned.
I sense something....
I'm afraid so.
Did you say "next to impossible"?
Just felt a chill....
I hope you'll prove me wrong.
If you're free, we really should have a conversation about your agent.
About Agent Kovach....
It will have to wait. Behind you.
I think you were eavesdropping. I think you can't stop thinking about me.
[Flirt] Stalking me?
I would hope you're joking except this is hardly the time for it. And by the way, do look behind you.
Plan's over. Scrapped. Some giant thing tore through a junction, caused an electrical surge. Dampeners are shot.
There has to be another way.
Let's make a new plan.
It must have been a Monolith.
The former Emperor's work.
And you expect me to take your word for it. What's your angle, Kovach?
I don't trust you....
Whatever it was, I wouldn't want its attention....
I want this nightmare to end. That's my angle.
Besides, the two fleets have engaged each other. Maybe if we convinced Saresh or Darth Marr to divert some forces....
Agent, report.
What's the word, Kovach?
It won't work, Minister. I failed.
I thought about an electrical bombardment from space, but it would be incredibly imprecise. We'd be as likely to kill a lot of people as anything.
The word is "failure". I couldn't make it work. I'm sorry, Agent Shan.
Yes, you did fail--and for the last time.
Agreed. [Kill him]
[Say nothing]
Agent--don't you have something else to say?
You must confess to Lana.
What have you done? Agent Kovach was a valued asset!
He was working for the Republic.
He was a double agent.
Your incompetence allowed the Republic to place a spy right under your nose. He was working for Saresh.
You let the enemy spy on you.
My reasons are my own. Do you have a problem with that?
I don't have to tell you.
Well?
He what?
I-- But I....
No. No, how could I have been so blind?
We'll talk of this later. Right now, I have a new plan in mind. You might not like it, but it's all we have.
I caught him talking to Saresh. He admitted his guilt.
Lana, we still have a problem to solve.
Yes, of course. And I may have found a solution. I doubt you'll like it.
I'm listening.
You must get all of his pawns--every last soldier, Jedi and Sith--to stop their slaughter and chase you into the heart of New Adasta.
You must make Vitiate want to kill you. Now.
Why don't you tell him all the reasons you're sorry?
You need to confess, Kovach.
[Say nothing]
"Sorry" doesn't cut it.
Not good enough. [Kill him]
Speak--or I will.
Minister Beniko, I... I place myself at your mercy.
Spit it out, Agent. We haven't all day.
I don't work for you. I answer to the Supreme Chancellor of the Republic. I'm sorry.
Sorry. You're sorry?
I see. In that case, I suggest we find another way for you to be of assistance, Agent. Report to my location immediately.
Yes, Minister.
Thank you.
Agent Kovach will be made accountable for his incompetence. In the meantime, Vitiate's pawns are still growing in number.
I have a strategy to suggest. You may find it unpleasant.
I want him executed. Now.
As you wish.
Gladly. [Kill him]
Clean up your own messes, Lana.
He's not my problem.
Very well.
No! Please!
Now let's move on. I have another plan. A better plan. However, it's not without a great deal of risk.
War has broken out across the globe. Our former Emperor, however, has limited his involvement to the area around New Adasta--near you.
I'm sure you did your best. That's all we can ask for.
This isn't the time. I'm sure we'd all be better off coming up with a new plan.
Are you insane? What was that?
Either you explain it or I do.
Agent Shan... I'm the reason we have troops on Ziost.
What are you talking about?
The chaos here, the Sixth Line.... Saresh knew about all of it because I told her.
And why would you do that?
I'm not your asset.
Agent Shan...? Sir, if you'll let me explain....
Go report to your boss. You're done with the SIS.
I said you're done!
But I can still help....
May the Force be with you.
Good luck.
I'm told Agent Kovach's plan fell apart. The good news is I have another plan. A better plan. However, it's an extremely dangerous plan--for you.
Kovach was secretly working for Saresh. You would never have been able to trust him.
He couldn't be trusted.
He didn't know I overheard him conspiring with the Emperor's puppets. He wanted us to fail, to spin our wheels.
[Lie] The Emperor corrupted him.
Don't question me.
He what? Are you sure?
He's the reason Saresh knew about the Sixth Line, knew about the chaos here.
You don't need to know why--only that I saw it as necessary.
It was a command decision. My decision.
I've got my reasons. That's all you need to know.
That idiot! How many lives is this going to cost us?
Still, you didn't have to kill him. Look, I-- We need to table this for now.
I'm trying to work through channels to get our troops out of here, trying to get through to my ops team, trying to reach Lana....
I'm trying.
I don't understand. Was he possessed or just out of his mind?
It's difficult to say with any certainty. He had us all fooled.
Hard to say for sure, but he put on quite a show.
Yeah. Yeah, I guess he did.... I'd love to wrap my head around this, but we don't exactly have the luxury of time.
Unbelievable. All the work I put into recruiting and training and placing him, and just like that, you....
Look, this conversation isn't over, but I've got several distinct layers of headache to deal with right now.
Lana.
Look, maybe you should check in with Lana. If you can, get her to reach out to me.
I'll do that.
You have my thanks.
I don't think it's a coincidence. It's possible he isn't as strong as he's been letting on. It's possible he's worried about what you could do.
Makes sense.
Me?
[Say nothing]
I'm ready for him.
I've seen inside his twisted mind, bested his Voice. He knows I'm a threat to him.
Fear is at the heart of Sith philosophy. And he is its purest expression.
That's because he knows I don't give up.
It's pretty well known I'm a huge threat to would-be galaxy eaters everywhere.
Makes... sense...?
I took down Arkous. Stopped Revan. He knows I mean business.
He should be worried.
Vitiate knows what I've done in his name. He's right to fear me.
He sees in me someone who could one day surpass him. He has every right to be worried.
It was always going to lead to this. Let him come for me.
I do not fear Vitiate. Let him come for me.
I'm not joking, Captain. You've clearly gotten under his skin. That's the advantage we'll use to stop him.
I'm just a soldier. It's not like we have any SOP for taking down Sith spirits, or whatever he is now.
The galaxy-eating ghost is worried because... he thinks I'm going to beat him in a quick draw?
Not to sell myself short, but I don't think he's too concerned about one lone bounty hunter.
If that's the case, I think he overestimates the capabilities of the Empire's intelligence apparatus.
I'm going to suggest something a little more proactive, actually.
Good, I need you to maintain that confidence for what's to come.
Yes, he very well does. That's why you're the key to this plan, Master Jedi.
Explain it however you like, but you've gotten under his skin. That much is clear--and it's the advantage we'll use to stop him.
Quite a simplification, I think, but this is no time for debate.
There. The "mess", as you call it, has been cleaned.
Get out of here, Agent.
Kovach--run.
What?
Shut off the holo and run.
You let him live.
That's right.
If I find him, Agent Kovach will be made accountable for his incompetence. But there's no time for that now. Vitiate's pawns are growing in number.
